title: Underwhelming at best
text:
Hi,

This is one of my very few bad reviews about anything. Ordered a simple beef and shrimp soup with a side beef rice wraps. I had asked for the soup to be spicy as I did not have the menu on me and was driving. The soup broth is not spicy and taste like 80% fish sauce. The rice wraps we already ripped opened as well. I am rarely disappointed especially with a Vietnamese soup but it would be my advice to consider another location. It might be just a today issue as other people seemed to had positive experiences but I give my meal a 1.5/5

title: I am a big fan of middle eastern
text: I am a big fan of middle eastern food and I have to say that I have tried plethora of restaurants in the Ottawa Gatineau region. Amiral is a stand out among the mere mortals. Not only is the meat portion very generous at around 900 grams but the the items are overall are tastier than the competition. The generous portion and amazing taste makes it a no brainer at a price lower than the completion! Big fan and you should give it a shot. Like this post of you agree!

title: Worth going for half a day
text: The ocean was rough when we were there and the beach vendors were everywhere but the experience was still good. I would recommend spending an afternoon here but nothing more. The water is beautiful and so is the sand but the lack of tranquility brings you back to earth. The best way to visit this beach is to make it part of an organised tour that stops here for a couple of hours.

title: Peaceful island with plenty of restaurants!
text: We loved Lipe. Two main streets going across the island are occupied by restaurants and shops. You will find every cuisine on this island. All bars close at around 11:00 pm to midnight which permits you to have a peaceful sleep. There are nice bungalows on the north east of the island north of sunrise beach. It is so easy to walk around the island and the island is extremely cozy. There are natural a lot of day trips to be done and luminescent plankton can be seen of shore at night when splashing the water on shore. Make sure to go to the Rockstones Bar in the middle of the island for a special treat ;).

title: Views for a great price
text: Great spot at affordable prices. Cant beat the view! Other reviews have covered all the basis. Don't hesitate just go.

title: Thursday "Night" Football
text:
Was there for the Thursday Night NFL game on Nov. 7 2019. It was lovely to have access to the game with your feet in sand. I was the only person there since it was 10 am but the pints were delicious. The manager came out and said it was rare that people request NFL games and told me she also had Philip Rivers in her pool but that's a different story!

No the cheapest spot on the island but love the set up of the bar with tables, lounging areas and bar stools. Overall I was very satisfied and rode my bicycle out of there with a smile.

title: Average course at professional prices
text: The course originally established in 1907 as a 9 hole is now converted into an 18 hole course. The course in very green since water is close buy and this helps with irrigation. Some holes are very nice but a lot of them leave something to be desired. I would probably play again for a green fee closer to the $65 mark instead of the $82.50 we paid.

title: 1 year anniversary dinner
text: The restaurant has high ceilings and is not too crowded. The scallop dish was out of the world and the other dishes were nice as well. We were a tad disappointed with the oysters but they were still ok. The BYOB really makes the value of this restaurant skyrocket. We will be coming back.

title: Great spot for a date
text: Great spot for a date and sushi lovers. Thick and tender sashimi and fantastic sushi. You will not be disappointed. Very chic yet laid back. Loved every minute of it

title: Good poutine and classic pogo
text: Good poutine and classic standard pogos. If you are hungry and passing by you will not be disappointed. Ive had better but also much worse.

title: Combination for two B
text: We ordered the “Combinations served by the bowl For two (B)”. The Lamb Bhuna was to die for. The Mix Vegetable Curry was also pretty tasty however, we found the butter chicken to be a little too liquid and left a little to desire overall. A recommendation for the restaurant would be to serve at least two pieces of Naan with a dinner for two. Overall very satisfied and I will perhaps make my own combination next time as a spicy dish would have been lovely to compliment the supper. This was not the first nor that last time I will order from this establishment.

title: Heart of Dowtown
text: Great place to soak in the sun and grab a drink at the Tavern on the Hill. Major Hill Park embraces the capital vibe with its peacefulness and landscape.

title: Amazing prices
text: I have to say that I have ordered over 20 times from this location in the past year. The prices are great and the food is tasty. When I first ordered from this location I was not expecting anything as the prices were so low. 19.99 for a large three toppings pizza with 16 wing! Get tf outta here! I strongly recommend.

title: Greber pizza has a wide variety
text: Greber pizza has a wide variety of items on their menu. In general, any choice is good. Albeit not comparable to a home cooked meal, Greber pizza is a great choice compared to other delivery restaurants. My last order was a Ground beef, mushrooms, green olives and onions pizza which was a 7.75/10. I ordered fries on the side which we’re thick and crispy 9/10.

title: Great food but the portion
text: Great food but the portion size of the family plate which cost me $84 on Uber Eats was way too small for the price. Very disappointed about the portion.

title: Beach front hotel
text:
The hotel is located right on the beach with more than half the rooms facing the ocean. The beach front pool on the 3rd floor i believe which is the same floor as the checking lobby is great. The beach located right in front of the hotel is also convenient if you want to get massages and buy souvenirs. The beach is very busy with a lot of people offering to sell items such as beer and/or food such as oysters for example. For individuals seeking a more relaxed beach you can go south west to the beach facing westwards which is much more laid back from the hustle and bustle since most beach front properties are condos and not hotels therefore less touristy. Overall the hotel was good and you need to grab a taxi from the old town at night as it can get a little dark on the walk back. On the way back to the hotel there are police roadblocks that flag taxis and search individuals for drugs. A fine/bribe will be demanded upon not being compliant with the drug laws of Colombia. The rooms are clean and smell good and resemble the pictures already posted on TripAdvisor.

In conclusion, I spent 5 days at Intercontinental and it was good for a big group of us with the pool but for smaller groups I would recommend a rental in Old City as it is much more charming.

title: The food is always tasty
text: The food is very tasty and I am always 100% satisfied. The Shawarma Palace locations all have great food and I would recommend it. It is my firm belief that Shawarma Palace is the best in Ottawa.

title: Great spot
text: My wife and I were staying at the nearby Hotel du Nord et de l'est and came to this lovely location multiple times over our 5 days. Nothing but good things to say and a lovely place to people watch. Bon service et sans doute une belle petite place comme on dirait au Québec.

title: Downtown at least
text: This hotel is mostly rented by the government for temporary stay possibly for individuals that need medical assistance coming from rural parts of the province of Quebec from what I understood. This hotel is busy and very loud and was not ideal. I would suggest choosing another option. Also, I never had a hotel room with three locks which was not comforting. In other circumstances the hotel could have potential as the rooms were ok if you didn't think about what went on in there before you.

title: Lovely surprise
text: This hotel should be rated higher. The rooms are lovely and the rooftop bar is amazing. we stayed here three nights and only found out about the rooftop bar on the last night. The breakfast included was good and the overall experience was very good. For the price we paid I don't believe we could of been happier.

title: Great food in a fun area
text: The food and drinks were great and served by a lovely staff. This is a great smokehouse and the ambiance was great.
place: San Juan Smokehouse - La Placita de Santurce

title: Nice stroll
text: Old San Juan is colorful and brings you back a couple centuries. The Castillo San Felipe del Morro is a must see. There are multiple restaurants and cafes around and plenty of spots for the IG influencers ;). We visited post hurricane in May 2018 but the whole country is getting back into full operation mode. A great visit and we will sure be back in the upcoming years.

title: Small room but quaint hotel
text: Nice looking hotel situated right in town and walking distance from everything. Close to the water therefore the boat day excursions are a couple minutes walk away, There is a great restaurant beside the hotel that serves local food at a very cheap price for the town as some restaurants are the same prices as Canada/US. The room was small but that's all we needed. The hotel was almost fully booked and we could only stay one night.

title: Great stay and friendly service
text: The staff at the hotel were very nice and accommodating. The grounds are nice and the restaurant is very tasty. The included choices for breakfast were great. There is an area out front where you can park your scooter. Big thumbs up.

title: Quick walk from the ferry and to the bars
text: Close to beach, restaurants, bars and the ferry which was nice. We had the first room behind the reception therefore it was a bit noisy as sometimes loud music was playing outside from the dive shop across the street. Overall the hotel was good but we expected a bit more perhaps. The pool was clean and the restaurant was less than stellar. I would have liked to try another hotel in order to compare but I did not have the time after booking three nights at this resort. The main highlight was being close to the main strip with access to bars and restaurants.

title: Complicated and much better options available, trust me on this one.
text:
Considering that after a month of travel we had nothing but the best hospitality and service throughout the Philippines this place was a surprise to us.

The address given by booking.com was false and it lead me to a military base/housing (not sure). The address read as 13 West Point road whereas I believe it is KM 13 West Point road. I have no clue but ended up finding it after a long and costly taxi ride a 3 am. Once I finally reached the destination the staff was extremely rude and not helpful. I could possibly give them a pass as they were sleeping behind the front desk since it was the middle of the night however the same disrespectful service was given the second day and I am an outgoing polite and joly person. I was also given an access card that was cracked and when I returned it I was charged 500 pesos because it was damaged. The crack had gotten a bit larger and they refused to acknowledge that I was given a damaged card to start with. Overall it was mind blowing how horrible the overall experience was and please do yourself a favor and book somewhere else.

title: Great hotel and rooftop restaurant
text: We booked a couple hours prior to arriving and we were met at the door since we had provided our estimated time of arrival. The gentleman waiting for us took our luggage and was nice enough to go park our vehicle. The rooftop restaurant was closing however they made an exception and cooked us a beautiful meal. Our room was facing the back garden and was extremely lovely. Overall a 5 star stay in a hotel that would go for at least 20 times the price in Canada. A quick walk downhill and you will be in the middle of everything.

title: A symbol of classic spirit and civilization
text: Ancient and majestic. An obvious must see on this earth. Can be quite hot in the warmer season which is something to keep in mind.

title: Just walk in and enjoy
text: This place was right beside pour hotel. The pizza and pasta was good and fairly priced. Cozy vibe and good service. We walked in front of the restaurant for three days and decided to walk in on pour last night. We were very satisfied.

title: Very nice and still in use
text: 13th century castle that is still home to multiple families. Definitely worth the visit and there are multiple locations in which a drink and bite to eat can be had.

title: Fantastic experience in a cozy setting
text: After reading reviews we headed to find this local gem which was within walking distance of our hotel. We were glad to see that there was room for us as we had not seen the pictures and seeting is very limited. The food was good and Lili was a tremendous host. After a few shots of rakia, the other tables and ours started chatting and we also engaged in an arm wrestling contest to which Lili joined! The ambiance was one of a family gathering and the lunch lasted 2 hours with drinks and stories. I would highly recommend this place. our visit was back in October 2018 but I felt compelled to share the experience.

title: Fantastic supper valentines day 2020
text: Great food and a great background story on the restaurant. The wine was great and the food was amazing considering only local produce and ingredients from Colombia are used. The menu changes monthly I believe therefore no need to describe our dishes. Two couples with drinks for a total cost of under 200 CAN. Truly a great experience in a nice decor with attentive service.

title: Still developing
text: Not quite what we expected and the main square is now closed off do to crime and prostitution. A must visit nonetheless and do not miss El Arsenal The Rum Box!

title: They say best paella in the world
text: We had four paella dishes. Three different options which include two with rice and seafood, one with noodles and seafood to finish off with one squid ink rice seafood paella. The restaurant is lovely and the service was fantastic. The Spanish wines were fairly priced at 18,000 COP and were tasty. As for our dishes, we were content but nothing mind blowing. All in all a good experience and much cheaper than prices at home therefore we considered this a slightly better than average meal but far from the best paella on the planet. Still posted our dishes on IG @PrezQc.

title: Great tours on back to back days
text:
Guatape & coffee tour on one day and city tour & comuna 13 on the next. Carlos was great tour guide, very attentive to detail and very relaxed vibes. Medellin is a beautiful city and thanks to City Vibes Tour we were able to appreciate it even more. Next time I'm in Medellin I will definitely reach out to take advantage of the other tours offered. Medellin is an inspirational city with a lot of history to go along with the perfect weather. I also almost forgot that Carlos helped us obtain tickets for a soccer (futbol) match which was a great experience.

Thanks again!

title: Relaxed on the beach
text: Great place to take in some beach restaurants and drinks. This was our first stop outside of Manila which was a relief from the concrete jungle. Balicasag island is close by for some good snorkeling and a nice day trip. We also rented a scooter and made our way to the tarsier sanctuary as well as Loboc. The vibe was not as hectic as we thought and the hotels we very nice for under 45 CAD.

title: Great value
text:
This hotel is located in the El Nido bay with majestic views from the rooftop restaurant and infinity pool. If not on a backpacker budget, I would recommend this place to everyone. The room is comfortable with great AC.

We were 110% satisfied.

title: Great quality/price
text:
PROS:Amazing location and friendly staff.
CON: Overpriced breakfast ($29.44)

I will return to this location as it is located in the hearth of the action at a more than reasonable price. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The king size bed was very confortable and the high ceiling in the room gives a soothing touch.

title: Great sunset
text: You will find the Octave Rooftop bar on the 45th floor. Be sure to catch the happy hour 2 for 1 right before sunset. Great drinks and spectacular view!

title: A better Sugar
text: This place is quite fancy with a great restaurant on the first floor. The staff is friendly and the bar is non smoking which is an upgrade from the Sugar nightclub. The Firm is still relatively new therefore not yet on everybody's nightlife "to do" list but I am confident that this establishment will flourish into the most prominent hip hop nightclub in Bangkok.

title: Amazing property and service
text:
I traveled here in October 2014 with friends for a golf trip. The property and staff were amazing as well as the condo. I would just like to note that my passport was stolen from my room as I had left it on a table inside the condo. I guess I should have been more diligent and used the safe!

Bring a lot of water if you are to golf!
place: Grand Luxxe at Vidanta Riviera Maya

title: Busy, huge and scenic
text:
My girlfriend and I were at the Port to catch a ferry to the Cyclades. The port is bustling with both a lot of people and a large amount of massive boats that are up to 7 stories. I was very impressed as it was our first time in a Mediterranean boat hub. Should you have a chance I would suggest saving some time to walk around as there are multiple interesting boutiques and restaurants in the charming streets of Piraeus which provide a taste of local culture.

On a more negative connotation you should be aware that there are a lot of pickpockets and my girlfriend let her guard down in our last 200 feet before getting on the cruiser and her iPhone got lifted from her pocket as she was walking right behind me. I had noticed a family of about 10 "gia marias" making weird movement beside us.

FYI: When you get a compliment remember to say ‘Skorda (garlic)’ under your breath and spit three times on yourself. If you know the individual that is complimenting you, tell them to spit on you too.

title: Slice of heaven
text:
We traveled a group of 4 friends in our early thirties to this beautiful beach front property in November 2010. I have to say that the one hour boat ride from the mainland in Belize City to the docks of the Tackle Box in San Pedro was magnificent. We had dolphins jumping out of the water following our boat and the closer we got to Ambergris Caye the clearer the water became. Upon arrival to the impressive Estates via water taxi we were greeted on the dock by a polite employee who provided us some warm wet hand towels to remove the salt water residue from our boat trip. We had no idea what to expect and we were quite impressed with everything and couldn't wipe the smiles of our faces while enjoying a welcome drink which was ready for us on our kitchen island in the condo. The hotel had reserved a golf cart for us which we would use to travel the island for the upcoming week and is a must to get around without having to wait on water taxis who also stop running after dark to prevent accidents from happening and to protect the aquatic ecosystem. There are very few cars or trucks on the island with golf carts being the main means of transportation.

Your to do checklist should include snorkeling and fishing which are truly wonderful experiences. Restaurants and bars/clubs in San Pedro are very affordable and offer various experiences to suit your mood for the day.

As for the condo itself you can view travelers' photos and admire the custom handmade finishes throughout.

Great piece of property and lovely island. I talk about this trip every chance I get and will be back in the future!

title: Great restaurant
text: Within walking distance of the Belizean Cove Estates where we stayed is this gem. Great food for all three meals of the day with excellent french pressed coffee. The owner was quite helpful in helping us book a fishing trip and recommended some activities for us to do throughout the week.

title: A must on any NYC trip
text: Great collection, great location and great building. The MoMA should be in your itinerary at any time of the year.
